column4: I've just patched and built a new kernel, and put it in /boot.  How do I need to reconfigure GRUB to recognize it?
when you were compiling your kernel. You did make dep; make modules; make modules_install?
Oh, no.  I just ran make modules_install
It didn't say to run 'make dep' or 'make modules' in the INSTALL or README files, but I guess that they assumed you should know that. =)
But how do I specify the kernel to use for building it?  I think I've found the answer on redhat.com
